text: Inflammation and infection are major determinants of disease severity and consequently , the quality of life and outcome for patients with cystic fibrosis ( CF ) .
<extra_id_0> Interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is a key inflammatory mediator .
Secretion of biologically active <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> involves inflammasome - mediated processing .

text: Little is known about the contribution of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the inflammasomes in CF inflammatory disease .
This study examines inflammasome - mediated <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production in CF bronchial epithelial cell lines and human patients with CF .

text: Bronchial epithelial cell lines were found to produce negligible amounts of basal or stimulated <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> compared to hematopoeitic cells and they did not significantly upregulate caspase-1 activity upon inflammasome stimulation .

text: In contrast , peripheral blood mononuclear cells ( PBMCs ) from both CF and healthy control subjects produced large amounts of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and strongly upregulated caspase-1 activity upon inflammasome stimulation .

text: PBMCs from CF patients and controls displayed similar levels of caspase-1 activation and <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production when stimulated with inflammasome activators .

text: This <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> production was dependent on NF-kappaB activity and could be enhanced by priming with LPS .

Finally , chemical inhibition of CFTR activity in control PBMCs and THP-1 cells did not significantly alter <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or IL-8 production in response to P . aeruginosa .

text: Hematopoeitic cells appear to be the predominant source of inflammasome - induced pro-inflammatory <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in CF . PBMCs derived from CF subjects display preserved inflammasome activation and <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> secretion in response to the major CF pathogen Pseudomonas aeruginosa .
